summary: Nancy P Schultz was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978. These documents list her name, position, and salary during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents span from October 1977 to November 1978, indicating her employment with the HSCA during that period. The consistent appearance of her name across these administrative documents suggests she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
significance: Nancy P Schultz's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's work.
